reviewText: I have a few other Extreme Engineering tapes, this one is by far one of the least satisfying documentary. It starts out quite ambitious, like all the other EE videos introducing the scope of the project, the team involved, and the geographical/weather obstacles faced by the project's team of experts. Having stated that, the movie then moves in a really fast speed where scant information are given the viewers. In the end, the movie seemed to have been cut short because it doesn't explain the final stages of the entire construction. It really left me sitting there asking myself, "is there a part B disc for this episode"?
